results.title: 3,900 million and one
results.creator_credit: Anthony Mayer, Oxfam and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World around us”.
Examines the way of life of a farming family living in the south of India. Provides an insight into the benefits and problems associated with the extended family system in rural India.

group_siblings.title: The Living forest
group_siblings.creator_credit: Suzanne Gibbs, Christopher Parsons and BBC-TV

results.title: The Living forest
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Gibbs, Christopher Parsons and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World around us”.
The New Forest stands at the crossroads. For 900 years it has remained relatively unspoiled, providing a refuge for shyer animals such as badgers, deer and foxes. But the combined pressures of thousands of visitors keen to “get back to nature” plus the harvesting of trees are threatening the forest’s very existence.

group_works.title: The Broken covenant (A)
group_works.creator_credit: David M. Thompson, ABC-TV (Australia) and BBC

results.title: The Broken covenant (A)
results.creator_credit: David M. Thompson, ABC-TV (Australia) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Encounters”.
Many of Australia’s urban Aborigines live in appalling physical conditions and are seen by some Australians as derelicts. But to Father Ted Kennedy, a Catholic priest who works in the inner-city suburb of Redfern, they still retain an essential quality of life missing in white society.

results.title: A Plain and sacred right (A)
results.creator_credit: David M. Thompson, ABC-TV (Australia) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Encounters”.
Looks at why Aboriginal people feel so strongly about their struggle for land rights. Filmed mainly at Noonkanbah, the scene of bitter Aboriginal demonstrations of 1980, the program looks at what Aboriginal people are now doing to preserve their traditional way of life. Tribal Aboriginals explain their bond with the land and put their views on white society.

group_works.title: A Taste of France. - Volume 2.
group_works.creator_credit: Gian Manara and International TV Consortium

group_works.title: A Taste of France. - Volume 2. (Captioned)
group_works.creator_credit: Gian Manara and International TV Consortium

results.title: A Taste of France. - Volume 2. (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gian Manara and International TV Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “International cookbook series”.
Demonstrates a variety of French recipes prepared by regional chefs including Coq au vin, Coq au Riesling, Fricassee of Burgundy, Snails, Sauerkraut, Quiche Lorraine, Alsatian cheesecake, Pears Charlotte and Saddle of lamb.

results.title: A Taste of Germany
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “International cookbook series”.
Includes marinated fillets of perch, Eisben-Leg of pork, cream cheese souffle with raspberry puree, eel soup, dumplings and spring chicken salad.

results.title: A Taste of Hungary
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “International cookbook series”.
This video looks at the cuisine and country of Hungary, once the centre of an empire. Dishes demonstrated include Pheasant soup, Pancakes with chocolate sauce, Matyos chicken soup and Saddle of lamb a la Palozen.
